learning_hub.title: Mobility Assistance
learning_hub.short_description: Learn how to move safely and independently using aids like canes, walkers, and wheelchairs.
step_by_step: Assess your environment for obstacles and safe paths.
Choose the correct mobility aid based on your needs.
Practice using the aid with support if needed.
Maintain good posture while moving.
Gradually increase distance and confidence.
do_and_dont: Do keep pathways clear of clutter.
Do ask for help when trying a new aid.
Don't rush or overexert yourself.
Don't use damaged or inappropriate equipment.
helpline_numbers: 1800-233-2002 - National Institute for Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities

learning_hub.title: Communication Skills
learning_hub.short_description: Improve your ability to communicate effectively, including speech, sign language, and assistive devices.
step_by_step: Identify the communication method that suits you best.
Practice daily with family, friends, or caregivers.
Use visual aids or assistive technology if needed.
Be patient and give yourself time to learn.
Seek professional guidance for speech therapy if required.
do_and_dont: Do maintain eye contact when possible.
Do use gestures or signs to support your message.
Don't feel embarrassed about asking for clarification.
Don't isolate yourself from social interactions.
helpline_numbers: 1800-233-2002 - National Institute for Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities

learning_hub.title: Daily Living Skills
learning_hub.short_description: Learn to perform everyday tasks safely and independently.
step_by_step: Start with simple tasks like dressing and personal hygiene.
Break tasks into smaller, manageable steps.
Use adaptive tools to make tasks easier.
Practice regularly to build confidence.
Ask for assistance only when necessary.
do_and_dont: Do organize your space for easy access to essentials.
Do take regular breaks to avoid fatigue.
Don't ignore safety precautions.
Don't feel pressured to do everything at once.

learning_hub.title: Learning and Education
learning_hub.short_description: Access education resources, including digital tools and inclusive learning methods.
step_by_step: Identify subjects or skills you want to learn.
Choose resources suitable for your abilities.
Set a regular study schedule.
Use assistive technologies like text-to-speech or screen readers.
Seek guidance from teachers or mentors when needed.
do_and_dont: Do ask for learning materials in accessible formats.
Do practice consistently to reinforce learning.
Don't compare yourself to others.
Don't skip asking for help if a topic is difficult.
helpline_numbers: 1800-121-5225 - Ministry of Education Helpline for Inclusive Education

learning_hub.title: Health and Wellness
learning_hub.short_description: Maintain physical and mental well-being through proper care and routines.
step_by_step: Schedule regular medical checkups.
Engage in gentle physical activity as advised by professionals.
Eat a balanced and nutritious diet.
Practice relaxation techniques and mindfulness.
Report any health concerns promptly.
